Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers have been the biggest shock of the NBA this season with their new head coach, Kenny Atkinson.
The Hornets are breaking records in all of the wrong ways, having lost their last 17 out of 18 games.
The Cavaliers are on the path to having 72 wins, a mark that very few teams have reached in NBA history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hornets have had their injuries that have played a massive role in their poor performance.
Evan Mobley has had a huge impact in the matchups versus the Hornets, surpassing a career-high 41 points in the recent game between these two teams.
The Hornets lost both matchups to Cleveland earlier in the season, resulting in double-digit losses.
Others: The Hornets' two-star players, LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller, have missed the past couple of games, making it difficult for them to generate open looks on the offensive end.
With the added days of rest that the team has had recently, there might be a solid chance that at least one of Ball or Miller will make their return to the lineup on Sunday versus Cleveland.
The Hornets have to find a way to prevent the Cavaliers from getting uncontested looks at the rim while also winning the battle on the boards.
